title: Armelle Ballian
text:
I am a geologist whose main interests cover sedimentary geology, exogenous processes and paleoenvironmental studies.
My PhD project is part of the second phase of a DFG-funded SPP ‚ÄòMountain Building Processes in Four Dimensions (MB-4D)‚Äô.
The project, entitled ‚ÄòReconstructing Eastward Propagation of Surface Uplift in the Alps: Integrating Stable Isotope Paleoaltimetry and Paleoclimate Modelling (REAL)‚Äô aims at constraining the surface uplift history of the European Alps in a paleoclimatic context.
My project focuses on the Western and Eastern Alps, along with extending the record for the Central Alps to pre-Miocene times. The research focuses on stable isotope-based paleoelevation and paleoclimate reconstructions (·∫ü18O, ·∫üD, D47-D48). The obtained ·∫ü-·∫ü paleoaltimetry and clumped isotope-derived paleotemperature records are coupled with an isotope tracking atmospheric General Circulation Model (GCM) performed by colleagues from the ‚ÄòEarth System Dynamics Group‚Äô at the University of T√ºbingen.
When I am not working on the Alpine surface uplift history, I am playing cello, boxing, hiking or crafting.
